ResourceHeader.ResourceName: Characteristics of Reconnection Sites and Fast Flow Channels in an MHD Simulation. Supplementary MHD simulation movie mS2-Bz.mp4 for 14 March 2008.
ResourceHeader.Description: This movie illustrates the development of the vertical component of magnetic field in the neutral surface. At the start of the movie, the field is everywhere quite weak, even in the flow channels. By 04:11 UT, the fast flow compresses the magnetic field ahead of it turning a narrow region to reddish brown. Similar compression appears at 04:32 UT as the extended narrow flow channel begins to form. Shortly later, the region encompassing the THEMIS orbits begins to turn continuously red indicating the accumulation of magnetic flux in the region. By 04:44 UT, the single flow channel continues to deliver magnetic flux to this region. As shown in the text, this is the time identified as expansion onset when tail field rotates to a more dipolar configuration. Contours of Vx = 250 km/s are denoted by heavy black lines. Heavy black and white lines at >10 Re pre-midnight depict the location of THEMIS spacecraft. A dashed black semi-circle defines synchronous orbit. White lines are contours of plasma pressure. The Earth is a green half-circular patch.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Mostafa El-Alaoui, Raymond J. Walker; Robert L. McPherron

PublicationInfo.Authors: R.L. McPherron; M. El-Alaoui; R.J. Walker; and R.L. Richard

Funding.Project: Substorm current wedge development and evolution using THEMIS observation and simulations
Structure and evolution of plasma sheet fast flows using THEMIS observation and global MHD simulations
GEM: A Statistical Study of the Substorm Sequence and Phenomena Associated with Expansion Onset

InformationURL.Name: Virtual Magnetospheric Observatory directory containing movies for Journal of Gephysical Research publication.

AccessInformation.Acknowledgement: If data downloaded from the VMO Data Repository are used in publication kindly acknowledge the Virtual Magnetospheric Observatory, Earth, Planetary and Space Science Department, University of California, Los Angeles for providing access to the data.

Parameter.Name: MHD simulation movie of GSM X component of position for 14 March 2008
Parameter.Description: Two dimensional display of this movie of the GSM X component of position is on the original.

Structure.Description: Each image is 3840 pixels by 1890 pixels and there are 360 frames in the movie.

Parameter.Name: MHD simulation movie of GSM Y component of position for 14 March 2008
Parameter.Description: Two dimensional display of this movie of the GSM Y component of position is on the original.

Structure.Description: Each image is 3840 pixels by 1890 pixels and there are 360 frames in the movie.

Parameter.Name: MHD simulation movie of GSM Z component of magnetic field for 14 March 2008
Parameter.Description: Two dimensional display of this movie of the GSM Z component of magnetic field is on the original, not interpolated grid.

Structure.Description: Each image is 3840 pixels by 1890 pixels and there are 360 frames in the movie.

Parameter.Name: MHD simulation movie of GSM plasma flow velocity for 14 March 2008

Parameter.Description: Two dimensional display of this movie of the GSM plasma flow velocity interpolated grid.
